page.title: 08NORTH BRENT - RELIGION
page.content: RELIGION. A survey showed that one third of the people in the area belong to the Christian Protestant Church of England, one quarter are Hindus of various sects and one tenth Moslem. There are also numbers of Roman Catholic Christians,Jews, Sikhs and Buddhists. Many of the Christians seldom go to church except for Easter and Christmas and formal occasions such as weddings and funerals.The children who sing in choirs are paid. The Moslems visit the mosques once or twice a week. The Roman Catholics go to Mass at least once a week. There are ten Christian churches in the area including United Reform, Baptists and Methodists. All Christian denominations are represented. There are three mosques, three synagogues, (one liberal) and there are plans to build a huge Hindu temple.
